186009753.review:
CoD Campaign but it's a western. The game is a product of its time. Take it for what it is...but maybe not for $15.

The Good - Duel mechanics that were surprisingly detailed; Fun plot twist at the end; Graphics were, in hindsight, fairly good for its time; Slower ADS speed (at least at first), so it's not "just" a point-and-click adventure; Bullet dodging mechanic was pretty fun; There was one level (or part of a level) that forces you to aim very carefully around a powder-keg of explosives.

The Bad - Linear levels that force you to go a certain way, no real freedom to make the story your own; Not entirely clear that honorable vs dishonorable kills does anything for the plot; BLOODY SCREEN SO REAL; Repetitive level designs that just drag on near the end; Hides the hardest difficulty behind a first playthrough; Cringe leveling system in the game that seems to take away from the game; No looting mechanic; Excessive amounts of ammo laying around even on higher difficulty, so there's really no point in trying to be strategic in your weapon use.

The Ugly - Bullet sponge bosses; Turret segments; Quick time events; Slow-mo powers that also gives you predator vision; and a $15 asking price, to this day, for an experience that can easily be completed with 3-4 hours or less.

I'm sorry, but I can't recommend this game, no matter how much people rave on the story and writing.

185818046.review:
Call of Juarez: Gunslinger recipe

Ingredients:
2 cups of Western Adventure
3 tablespoons of Engaging Storytelling
1 teaspoon of Sharp Shooting Mechanics
A pinch of Historical Figures
1 generous helping of Stylized Visuals
A sprinkle of Skill-Based Combat
Garnish with Memorable Narration

Directions:
Begin by stepping into the dusty boots of Silas Greaves, a legendary bounty hunter. The game’s setting in the Wild West provides the perfect backdrop for an action-packed adventure filled with gunfights and tall tales.

Combine the Western Adventure with the Engaging Storytelling. The seamless blend of narrative and action keeps you hooked from the very beginning, ensuring a rich and flavorful gaming experience.

Fold in the Sharp Shooting Mechanics, where precision and reflexes are key. The gunplay is satisfying and well-crafted, making each shootout an exhilarating experience.

Stir in Historical Figures for an added layer of authenticity. Encountering well-known outlaws and lawmen adds depth to the narrative and makes the journey even more intriguing.

Add a pinch of Stylized Visuals to enhance the aesthetic. The game’s comic book-inspired graphics create a unique and visually appealing experience, setting it apart from other Western games.

Sprinkle generously with Skill-Based Combat. The game rewards quick thinking and accurate shooting, allowing you to develop your own style and strategy as you progress.

Top off with Memorable Narration. Silas Greaves’ storytelling brings the game to life, adding humor, drama, and a touch of exaggeration that makes each mission unforgettable.

Serve your Call of Juarez: Gunslinger experience on a high-definition screen, with the volume turned up to fully appreciate the immersive sound design and captivating narration.

Tasting Notes:
Call of Juarez: Gunslinger is a masterful blend of Western adventure, storytelling, and sharp shooting. Its engaging narrative, satisfying gunplay, and unique visual style come together in a perfect recipe that delights fans of the Wild West and action games alike. Enjoy your thrilling journey through the frontier—just be sure to keep your wits and your aim sharp!

Bon appétit, and happy bunslinging!

185565881.review:
Брутальный Сайлас Гривз методично, передвигаясь от одного к другому, отстреливает отпетых головорезов за вознаграждение. В принципе, этого предложения вполне достаточно для описания данной игры.

Игры серии, в общем-то, никогда не славились ни Голливудской постановкой, ни интригующим сюжетом, и ни даже хоть сколько-то вменяемым ганплеем, но эта игра - апогей сделанного для галочки шутера, словно Call of Duty, только Juarez. Однако, в замечательной Bound in Blood была душа, которую авторы успешно растеряли в The Cartel, зачем-то вытащив серию на рельсы современных воин банд, и очевидно, что Gunslinger должна была быть неким "возвращением к истокам". Возвращение, на самом-то деле удалось, но опять же, каких-то существенных нововведений не чувствуется, а вторичность, увы, исходит ото всех щелей. К счастью, небольшая продолжительность сглаживает этот угол, и игре не удаётся надоесть за все свои 4-5 часов геймплея.

Моё итоговое впечатление скорее нейтральное. Очень нейтральное. Мне никак не удаётся отметить какие-либо плюсы, однако и минусов критических замечено не было. Но тем не менее - брать строго по скидкам, и ожидать скачивания без особого энтузиазма (особенно если вы играли в Bound in Blood) - в противном случае, игра рискует очень сильно разочаровать, а она это может без особых проблем.

Call of Juarez: Gunslinger delivers a focused and stylish Western experience. 185177655.review:
I had a really hard time getting into this - the combo/points system, the completely mad duel mechanic and the level-to-level arcade style shoot'em'up is too tall an order for me. At least I thought so.

Midway through the game, somewhere inbetween John Wesley Hardin and Grey Wolf, something clicked - I finally got it. I see what the hype was about. I can see why this game is so well regarded, because previously I saw it as a hard and outdated piece of shit.

The storytelling is superb - both writing wise and visually. I love the numerous rewinds or retellings of the same story, I love the comic book style intros to characters (or weapons) and it's a genuine treat to replay, because the levels don't overstay their welcome. Even if you speedrun it, the story remains cohesive, since it either briefly stops the game to finish a sentence or just cuts unnecesarry dialogue and moves on to the brunt of the story.

Gameplay wise, it's something you definitely need to get adjusted to. The duels are the devil the first time you encounter them, but there's a consistent strategy of wiggling the focus circle left and right, while trying to center your gun hand. Once you have that covered, you can get consistent 90-100% hand speed and focus bars. 

The combo/points seem intimidating at first, but my main advice is just to play and ignore them. My first playthrough on hard was anxiety fueled to say the least - trying to upkeep the combo, to get all headshots. True west showed me the error of my ways, the same way Silas Greaves got schooled by Grey Wolf. I learnt not to try to pursue my rage and pride, to subdue my anger and  spread lead joy with glee in my face.

Poeticism aside, it's a game you learn to love, just give it a chance. The bonus gamemodes (duels and arcade) aren't that difficult to complete and give the player some much needed release (at least it did for me) to try out your skills that you've mastered over two playthroughs, if you went for 100%.

185171957.review:
Call of Juarez: Gunslinger – Ein Meisterwerk des Wilden Westens

Ein Ritt durch die Legenden und Mythen des Alten Westens
Call of Juarez: Gunslinger ist mehr als nur ein Spiel; es ist eine Reise in eine Ära voller Mythen, Geschichten und den brutalen Realitäten eines gesetzlosen Landes. Du schlüpfst in die Rolle von Silas Greaves, einem Kopfgeldjäger, der mit scharfer Zunge und tödlicher Präzision die bekanntesten Revolverhelden des Wilden Westens jagt. Hier, in der ungezähmten Wildnis, entscheidet der Colt über Leben und Tod, und jeder Schritt birgt die Gefahr eines tödlichen Duells.
Atmosphäre: Eine Welt, die zum Leben erwacht

Von den staubigen Straßen verlassener Westernstädte bis hin zu den düsteren Ecken schummriger Saloons – Call of Juarez: Gunslinger fängt die Essenz des Wilden Westens mit beeindruckender Detailgenauigkeit ein. Das Spiel erschafft eine dichte, atmosphärische Welt, die dich sofort in ihren Bann zieht. Die knarzenden Holzdielen der Saloons, das entfernte Wiehern von Pferden, und das sanfte Klingen von Sporen, wenn du die Straße entlanggehst – jedes Geräusch und jedes visuelle Detail tragen dazu bei, eine lebendige und immersive Welt zu schaffen.

Die goldenen Sonnenuntergänge, die die Prärie in warmes Licht tauchen, kontrastieren stark mit den kühlen, schattigen Innenräumen der verfallenen Goldminen. Die melancholischen Klänge des Soundtracks untermalen jede Szene, von dramatischen Schusswechseln bis zu den ruhigeren Momenten, in denen du die raue Schönheit der Landschaft genießt.
Begegnungen mit Legenden:

Im Angesicht der Geschichte:
Du trittst gegen einige der bekanntesten Figuren des Wilden Westens an, darunter Billy the Kid, Jesse James und Pat Garrett. Doch diese Begegnungen sind mehr als nur Schießereien – sie sind Geschichten, in die du hineingezogen wirst. Silas Greaves erzählt von seinen Abenteuern mit einem Charme und einer Übertreibung, die jedes Zusammentreffen zu einem epischen Moment machen. Die Grenzen zwischen Wahrheit und Fiktion verschwimmen, während Silas seine Geschichte spinnt und die Spieler in seine persönliche Version der Ereignisse eintauchen.

Ein Erzähler mit Flair:
Silas ist ein unzuverlässiger Erzähler, dessen Geschichten sich dynamisch verändern können. Mal verschönt er die Wahrheit, mal fügt er überraschende Wendungen hinzu, die das Spielerlebnis frisch und aufregend halten. Diese einzigartige Erzählweise sorgt dafür, dass du nie genau weißt, was als Nächstes passiert, und gibt dem Spiel eine einzigartige narrative Tiefe.
Gameplay: Actiongeladene Duelle und taktische Feuergefechte

Der Weg des Revolverhelden:
In Call of Juarez: Gunslinger wirst du die Kunst des schnellen Ziehens und präzisen Schießens meistern. Die Schusswechsel sind intensiv und adrenalingeladen, während du dich durch die staubigen Straßen kämpfst oder dich hinter Felsen und Bäumen versteckst, um den perfekten Moment für den entscheidenden Schuss abzuwarten. Die Möglichkeit, Kugeln auszuweichen und tödliche Kombos zu erzielen, macht jedes Gefecht zu einem spannenden Erlebnis.

Anpassung und Fortschritt:
Mit jedem Sieg kannst du neue Fähigkeiten freischalten, die deinen Spielstil bereichern. Ob du ein Meister des Revolvers oder ein Präzisionsschütze mit dem Gewehr werden willst, das Spiel bietet dir die Werkzeuge, um deinen eigenen Weg zu gehen. Diese Anpassungen verleihen dem Spiel eine zusätzliche Tiefe und erhöhen den Wiederspielwert.
Ein Epos des Wilden Westens

Call of Juarez: Gunslinger ist eine Hommage an die Legenden des Wilden Westens, ein Spiel, das die Geschichten und Mythen mit einer packenden Erzählweise und fesselnden Schusswechseln zum Leben erweckt. Die sorgfältig gestalteten Umgebungen, die dynamische Erzählstruktur und das präzise Gameplay machen es zu einem unverzichtbaren Erlebnis für alle, die den Geist des Alten Westens spüren möchten.

Ob du dich auf den staubigen Straßen einer Geisterstadt einem tödlichen Duell stellst oder in den Schatten einer verfallenen Mine lauerst – in Call of Juarez: Gunslinger fühlst du dich wie ein echter Revolverheld, der seine eigene Legende schreibt. Pack deinen Colt, setz den Hut auf, und mach dich bereit für eine Reise, die du so schnell nicht vergessen wirst.

184613722.review:
Call of Juarez Gunslinger

Oyunda hikaye arka planda ama üzerine düşen görevi layığıyla yerine getiyor. Oyunun kendine has bir hikaye anlatım tarzı var. Oyun boyunca dikkatinizi hikayenin üzerinde tutmayı başarıyor, mizahi yönüyse oldukça kuvvetli. 
 Grafik konusunda 2013 yılında çıkmış olmasına rağmen kendine has çizgi romanımsı görselliği sayesinde bugün bile kendini oynatıyor. Oyunun asıl vurucu noktası oynanışı; vuruş hissi güzel , silah kullanımı keyifli , ilk bakışta silah çeşitliliği az gibi gözükebilir ama 6-6.30 saatlik bir oyun için fazlasıyla yeterli. Oyunun bölüm bölüm ilerlediğiniz bir yapısı var. Bence bölüm tasarımları oyunun zayıf olduğu bir nokta bölümler çoğunlukla dar koridarlorda ilerlemekten ibaret oyun bunu hissettirmemek için çözümü çevre tasarımlarında bulmuş bazen mağaralarda bazen hareketli bir tren üstünde aksiyona giriyorsunuz. Ama bölüm tasarımları tekdüze ve kendini tekrar ediyor. Kendini tekrar eden bir başka husussa boss savaşları, boss savaşları genel anlamda kötü bir kısmı sadece daha fazla cana sahip düşmanlar diğerleriyse siper alarak düşmana yaklaşma üzerine kurulu. Son olarak düellolara gelirsek basit bir mantığa sahip fena değiller, bu türde başka bir oyun oynamadığım için oyunun düellora yaklaşımında başka oyunlardan ve serinin diğer oyunlarından ne ölçüde iyi olduğunu bilmiyorum. Özetleyecek olursak eğer oynuyacak bir oyununuz yoksa veya uzun bir işe girişmek istemiyorsanız Call of Juarez Gunslinger sizin için ideal olabilir. indirim dönemlerinde şans verebilirsiniz.

184517003.review:
[h1]"Got a little business to take care of..."[/h1]
Call of Juarez: Gunslinger is the latest (final?) entry in the Juarez series. While sharing the same name, it is completely disconnected from the previous titles and can thus be played without having experienced the previous games. You play as Silas Greaves, a bounty hunter on a lifelong mission of revenge. While Gunslinger may be an FPS, and while it may not do anything truly unique, it is the way the elements are tied together which makes all the difference and sets it apart from other games in the genre.

The story unfolds as Silas, being recognised when walking into a bar in Abilene, recounts his life and adventures to a small group of listeners. The narration is extraordinary (perhaps only rivalled by the narrator in Bastion) and does an exceptional job of both sucking you into the world and imbuing it with the needed gravitas, as you would expect from a man hunting his prey. The entire game takes place in the past (relevant to where you are now), with adventures ranging from helping Billy the Kid escape jail to stopping Jesse James. While the game may be arcade in nature and have little focus on realism, there are also collectables hidden in the game world called Nuggets of Truth, which are factual titbits detailing the real lives and actual history of some of the people and events covered in the game. This is a really nifty way to engage with the audience and increase interest, as well as provide some balance to the story - Silas' listeners do occasionally call him out on certain things or express doubts that some of the tales might be a bit tall.

There are three main modes in Gunslinger: story (recounting Silas' experiences), arcade mode and duelling. Arcade mode is essentially a timed and scored challenge through a set of the story levels with a focus on finishing with the highest score possible. Points are awarded for speed, accuracy and style, with some vague similarities to Bulletstorm in this regard, if not so ludicrous. Duels, which you also encounter in story mode as a form of boss fight, are precisely what you think they are: an old-style showdown where both yourself and an opponent (AI) face off and draw to kill the other. Both modes have leaderboards and while there is no true multiplayer or co-op mode, this does serve as a form of competition and adds replay value.

The art style of Gunslinger is close to the cell shading used in the Borderlands games and reinforces the feeling of being in a comic book or dime novel story. There is also a comic-style art border around the screen which may or may not bother you (more on this below). As such, while it may not blow you away with graphical fidelity, it has aged well (better than the other titles in the series). The vibrancy of the colours (far from the expected dull varied shades of brown one may think to encounter in the Wild West) and the over-the-top arcade nature (think bullet time, slow motion blood spatters etc.) helps to reinforce that this was a living, breathing reality and further ties into how vivid Silas' recollections are. In addition to the narration, the soundtrack is also superb and does a marvellous job of setting the pace and tone: exciting when engaging, grandiose when facing someone down, quiet when reminiscing.

To help ease into duelling, I found the below guide helpful (all credit to OP):
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=419224184
Small tweaks, including removing the comic-style border, can be found below (all credit to OP):
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=193151743
Further tweaks (if needed) can be found at the PCGamingWiki page located at [url]https://www.pcgamingwiki.com/wiki/Call_of_Juarez:_Gunslinger[/url]

What Gunslinger is most of all though is fun: pure, undiluted fun - which is pretty much the entire point of games and something the majority of people miss. Highly recommended for anyone looking to enjoy themselves, anyone who enjoys FPS and anyone with any interest in this period of history; you will not regret your purchase.

Played on Windows 10/11 Pro x64 without any issues.

184111357.review:
Call of Juarez: Gunslinger is a refreshing and stylistic take on the Wild West, combining fast-paced gameplay with an engaging storytelling format. Released in 2013, this entry in the Call of Juarez series stands apart for its unique narrative delivery and arcade-style shooting mechanics.

[b]Storytelling Excellence[/b]

What truly sets Gunslinger apart is its narrative structure. The story unfolds through the recollections of Silas Greaves, an aging bounty hunter recounting his adventures in a saloon. This framing device allows for a dynamic and often humorous interplay between Greaves’ narration and the gameplay itself. His unreliable narration leads to unexpected twists—such as enemies suddenly changing positions or entire events being retold as the story evolves—creating a sense of unpredictability and charm.

Players encounter legendary figures from Wild West folklore, including Billy the Kid, Jesse James, and Butch Cassidy. While the historical accuracy is deliberately loose, the game’s exaggerated style captures the larger-than-life mythology of the era.

[b]Gameplay and Mechanics[/b]

Gunslinger excels in delivering a satisfying arcade shooter experience. The tight gunplay, complemented by a scoring system that rewards skillful kills and combos, keeps the action engaging. Silas’s arsenal includes revolvers, shotguns, and rifles, each feeling powerful and distinct. The addition of bullet-time mechanics and a "concentration" mode adds a layer of strategy to the otherwise fast-paced action.

The game also features a progression system, allowing players to unlock abilities in three distinct skill trees: Gunslinger, Ranger, and Trapper. This customization adds replayability and encourages experimenting with different playstyles.

[b]Visuals and Style[/b]

Visually, Gunslinger embraces a cel-shaded aesthetic that enhances its comic book-like presentation. The vibrant colors and stylized art direction bring the dusty towns, sprawling canyons, and saloons of the Wild West to life. Despite being a smaller-budget title, the game’s distinctive visuals give it a unique identity within the genre.

[b]Shortcomings[/b]

While Gunslinger shines in many areas, it’s not without flaws. The campaign’s relatively short length, clocking in at around 6-8 hours, may leave some players wanting more. Additionally, the lack of multiplayer or co-op modes feels like a missed opportunity given the game’s arcade-like nature. However, the New Game Plus mode and Arcade challenges do provide some incentive for replayability.

[b]Final Verdict[/b]

Call of Juarez: Gunslinger is a hidden gem that deserves a place in any Wild West fan’s library. Its innovative storytelling, stylish visuals, and satisfying gameplay combine to create an experience that’s both fun and memorable. While it’s a relatively short ride, it’s one packed with excitement and personality.

For those looking to live out their gunslinging fantasies or simply enjoy a unique narrative-driven shooter, Gunslinger is a must-play. It’s a testament to how creative design and solid mechanics can elevate a game, even without the trappings of a massive budget.

184016892.review:
[h1]16/20 Un FPS Mythique[/h1]

[h2]GRAPHISMES[/h2]
De prime abord, les graphismes sont plutôt bof pour du 2013, mais il y a un côté cel-shadé / cartoon très agréable avec une identité séduisante et très riche en couleur. Ça marche vraiment très très bien et ça n'a pas trop mal encaissé le poids des années.
À côté de ça, c'est fluide, ça tourne bien et c'est bien opti.
Petit point noir pour les utilisateurs de UW : le jeu repasse en 16/9 à chaque lancement et en plus les cutscenes ne le gèrent pas du tout. (mais ça c'est trop fréquent, malheureusement)

[h2]AUDIO[/h2]
On regrettera l'absence de doublage FR. Mais le doublage anglais est quand même de très bonne qualité et colle parfaitement à l'ambiance du jeu. Les musiques sont elles aussi superbes et contribuent à merveille à l'ambiance western.

[h2]GAMEPLAY[/h2]
On y retrouve un système très proche des Far Cry.
Un game design qui fonctionne bien.
Un mode fury.
Des compétences variées à la Far Cry 3.
Des checkpoints très proches les uns des autres.
Le système des duels est quant à lui un peu lourd.

[h2]SCÉNARIO[/h2]
Un scénario fidèle à la licence mais avec une narration vraiment forte, intéressante et une bonne dose d'humour décalé qui se conclut avec un bon climax de fin.

[h2]DURÉE DE VIE[/h2]
Le jeu possède 14 niveaux de environ 20 minutes. Tout à fait honorable.
Il y a également un mode arcade / duel qui est assez anecdotique, surtout que pour avoir les trophées il faudra farmer à mort l'XP pour débloquer les compétences et la rejouabilité du mode est horriblement mauvais. Même farmer des plantes sur WOW sera plus sexy. D'autant plus que l'obtention des compétences de ce mode est indépendante du mode histoire... Ça pue comment très fortement la durée de vie virtuellement élastique 

[h1]En Bref[/h1]
[h3]> Les Plus[/h3]
- Un revival de la licence très fort. Personnellement, je n'ai pas du tout accroché aux 2 jeux précédents qui ont très mal vieilli et je me suis contenté de let's play sur YouTube, impossible de m'y mettre. 
J'étais de fait très sceptique concernant ce 3ᵉ opus qui est, pour rappel, complètement indépendant des deux précédents et ne nécessitera pas les bagages de la licence.
- Bourré de petites touches innovantes.
- Une identité très séduisante.

[h3]> Les Moins[/h3]
- Les phases de duel ponctuant presque chaque niveau sont assez répétitives et finissent par être lassantes, surtout avec leur système un peu lourd.
- Un contenu additionnel too much.
- En cherchant loin, on pourrait reprocher éventuellement des scènes de fusillade parfois fouillies, les adversaires étant parfois difficiles à localiser. Heureusement, le mode fury permettra d'y voir plus clair.
- Une gestion de l'ultrawide à revoir.

184012526.review:
The story doesn't seem worth the frustration. If this were actually a FPS it would be fine, but it's not, the game constantly takes control away from you for "narrative" reasons. If you think investing in increased ammo for your main weapon is a good idea, think again, because you'll lose almost all your ammo for "narrative" reasons. If you focus on long range and play as stealthily and carefully as you can, it doesn't matter, you're suddenly in close combat for "narrative" reasons. This is neither a FPS nor is it a telltale style narrative game, it's rather somehow the worst possible fusion of the two.

Update: After nearly quitting the game and writing my initial review, I pushed past the frustration, trying to reach the end, in the hope that all the positive reviews were right. They weren't.

There is not a single redeeming quality to the gameplay at the end of the game. The penultimate fight involves practically no cover (for you only of course), enemies which are translucent and so largely invisible, and a seemingly never-ending supply of them, attacking from just about every angle, with instantaneous perfect aim, and dropping no ammo on death. Meanwhile, spent ammo didn't seem to reset after deaths (of which you can expect a great many), so eventually I simply had none. After that I just quit the game and watched the endings on YT. Apparently even if you manage to get through that bullshit fight, the suffering isn't over, the ending is locked behind yet another duel (as I learned from the YT vid), only worse than all the others in the game, because you not only have to deal with two enemies, but (unlike the only other duel involving two enemies) they're standing in completely different locations so you can't see them both or aim towards them both at the same time.

Now that I've gotten the full story, I don't understand all the positive reviews talking about the amazing story, it's not that good of a story, and definitely not so great as to be worth putting up with all the awful gameplay.

Call of Juarez Gunslinger is an enjoyable single-player cowboy-themed first-person shooter. I finished the main story in about 5 hours of playtime, playing a chapter here and there over a few months.

The story is well-crafted and fits the Wild West setting, with interesting characters and some fun twists. The gameplay is smooth and satisfying, with solid shooting mechanics that keep things engaging. Its linear structure makes it a good choice for players who like straightforward, story-driven shooters.

While it’s a fairly short game, the mix of entertaining gameplay and a strong Western vibe makes it a great pick for fans of the genre or anyone looking for a quick but fun experience.

Minhas conclusões finais sobre este jogo são muito positivas: ele é realmente divertido! Gostei tanto que até o platinei. No entanto, a história poderia ter sido mais desenvolvida, pois achei um pouco curta. Fora isso, é um jogo excelente para se distrair!

Лучше бы сделали продолжение про семейство Макколлов, чем этот шутер не о чём. Стильно, красиво, стрелять приятно, но сюжет писался, чтобы развеселить массового потребителя, а не представить вестерн в драматическом свете, как было в оригинальной дилогии.

Если первая часть Call of Juarez сейчас играется кривоватенько: неудобные стрельба и дуэли, вылеты и низкий ФПС, то вторая, Call of Juarez: Bound in Blood, очень даже хорошо сохранилась: и сюжетно, и геймплейно, и в техническом плане, выбор одного из двух персонажей почти в каждой главе (как будто хотели сделать кооператив), вот её стоит заценить всем.
